item.stacywolves.air_bone.tooltip: Rumoured to be liked by the mythical Cloud Wolf.
item.stacywolves.birch_bone.tooltip: The woody aroma is reminiscent of the Birch Wolf.
item.stacywolves.cake_bone.tooltip: The delicious cake reminds the Cake Wolf of its mother.
item.stacywolves.desert_bone.tooltip: Only a Desert Wolf would want anything to do with this spiky monstrosity.
item.stacywolves.diamond_bone.tooltip: This bone would break anything but a Diamond Wolf's teeth.
item.stacywolves.earth_bone.tooltip: The Dirt Dog will really dig this.
item.stacywolves.emerald_bone.tooltip: This bone will remind the Emerald Wolf of its home in the mountains.
item.stacywolves.end_bone.tooltip: End wolves will only eat bones with traces of The End in them.
item.stacywolves.ender_bone.tooltip: This ender-infused bone can maintain phase with the otherworldly Ender Wolves.
item.stacywolves.fire_bone.tooltip: Blaze-infused bones may satiate the apetite of the hellish Blaze Wolf.
item.stacywolves.flower_bone.tooltip: The aromatic bone flower will tempt the Flower Wolf.
item.stacywolves.gold_bone.tooltip: A bone of gold matches the Gold Wolf's bling.
item.stacywolves.ice_bone.tooltip: Sometimes known as a "Pupsicle".;Ice Wolves will love it. ;Don't eat the yellow snow.
item.stacywolves.iron_bone.tooltip: The Iron Wolf will surely enjoy this bone of steel.
item.stacywolves.mesa_bone.tooltip: Aperture Science engineered this bone to attract the Mesa Wolf.
item.stacywolves.mushroom_bone.tooltip: This mushy bone looks like it came from the cannibalistic Mushroom Wolf.
item.stacywolves.nether_bone.tooltip: Nether Wolves like their bones with a dollop of magma cream.
item.stacywolves.prismarine_bone.tooltip: A prismatic bone for a Prismarine Wolf.
item.stacywolves.redstone_bone.tooltip: This red bone seems to spark the interest of Redstone Wolves.
item.stacywolves.savannah_bone.tooltip: Savannah Wolves are reminded of the rains down in Africa.
item.stacywolves.skeleton_bone.tooltip: More bone than your body has room for.;Good thing that Bone Wolves have no body.;Grim wishes he could have such a bony bone \;)
item.stacywolves.water_bone.tooltip: This wet bone is a little soggy.;Only an Ocean Wolf could love it.
item.stacywolves.zombie_bone.tooltip: Zombie Wolves will eat ANYthing.... ugh.
item.stacywolves.meaty_bone.tooltip: Feeding this to a tamed wolf will prepare it for mating.
item.stacywolves.wolf_transporter.name: Ender Ball
item.stacywolves.wolf_transporter.toolti: Through the mighty power of Science;Stacy's Wolves may now be transported using the power of Ender!
item.stacywolves.wolf_clicker.name: Wolf Training Clicker
item.stacywolves.wolf_clicker.tooltip: Allows you to give basic commands to your lupine pals;Right click: Toggle wolf follow
item.stacywolves.wolf_remover.name: Emergency Wolf Remover
item.stacywolves.wolf_remover.tooltip: Right click a wolf to remove it. Use at your own risk.; Primarily for use if something goes wrong when tamedWolvesNeverDie is enabled.
item.stacywolves.wolf_whistle.name: Wolf Whistle
item.stacywolves.wolf_whistle.tooltip: One quick toot on this bony creation will have all tamed Wolves running to you.;Works even if the wolf is sitting.
item.stacywolves.inky_bone.tooltip: Sometimes a squid wolf will cover a bone in ink as a tasty snack.
item.stacywolves.solid_prismarine_bone.t: This bone is so tough that only the mighty Guardian Wolf dare chew on it.
item.stacywolves.glow_bone.tooltip: Witch Wolves will fetch these for their mystical mistresses in order to help brew potions.
item.stacywolves.book_bone.tooltip: Black and white and read all over.;Bookworm Wolves love to read these before eating them.
item.stacywolves.sunflower_bone.tooltip: This cheerful looking bone looks like it might impress the Sunflower Wolf.
item.stacywolves.cookie_bone.tooltip: Mmmm... Tasty! But too bony to be suitable for Humans! The Cookie Wolf would surely love this.
item.stacywolves.melon_bone.tooltip: Juicy! Melon Wolves are sure to take a liking to those who possess it.
item.stacywolves.lapis_bone.tooltip: This bone has been painted blue. Most likely to attract the attention of the elusive Lapis Wolf.
item.stacywolves.coal_bone.tooltip: This bone has been constructed of the finest coal. ;Guaranteed to turn the head of the discerning Coal Wolf.
item.stacywolves.red_sand_bone.tooltip: Bits of this bone manage to get everywhere. ;Better feed it to a Red Sand Wolf before it's too difficult to clean up.
item.stacywolves.fish_bone.tooltip: This bone looks (and smells! pooooh-we!) like it came from a fish. ;The cat-like Ocelot Wolf would smell it a mile away.
item.stacywolves.apple_bone.tooltip: Like a toffee apple, but less likely to ruin your teeth. ;Perhaps the Donkey Wolf will like it.
item.stacywolves.crafty_bone.tooltip: Welcome in any recipe, this bone might come in handy to the versatile Crafting Table Wolf.
item.stacywolves.wheat_bone.tooltip: No need to grind this bone to make bread. The Cow Wolf will love it.
item.stacywolves.torch_bone.tooltip: Once an object of curiosity for a secret team of alien hunters\;;this bone made of torch wood is now only of use to the Torch Wolf.
item.stacywolves.slime_bone.tooltip: This bone is covered in green slime. A slime wolf would stick to it like glue.
tile.stacywolves.wolfsbane_torch.tooltip: Keeps the hungry wolf at bay.
